citation.article-title: Staphylococcus microti sp. nov., isolated from the common vole (Microtus arvalis)
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Staphylococcus microti sp. nov.
Staphylococcus microti (mi.cro′ti. N.L. gen. n. microti of Microtus, the zoological name for a genus of vole, referring to the isolation of the first strains from individuals of Microtus arvalis).
Cells are Gram-stain-positive cocci, occurring singly or in irregular clusters.
Colonies are smooth, circular, slightly concave, opalescent whitish with continuous margins, 0.8–1.8 mm in diameter.
Catalase-positive and oxidase- and coagulase-negative.
Clumping factor is not detected by the latex test.
Growth occurs at 15, 37 and 45 °C and in the presence of 10 % NaCl, but not 15 % NaCl.
Produces δ-haemolysin on blood agar with sheep blood in synergy with a producer of β-haemolysin.
Produces alkaline and acid phosphatases, pyrrolidonyl arylamidase, β-galactosidase, arginine arylamidase and lecithinase.
Produces acid from d-glucose, d-fructose, lactose, trehalose, d-xylose, sucrose and N-acetylglucosamine, reduces nitrates and hydrolyses aesculin, Tween 80 and DNA.
Weak reactions are observed for esterase lipase (C 8) and leucine arylamidase in the API ZYM kit.
Other weak reactions are found for acetoin production and acid production from d-mannose.

Does not produce arginine dihydrolase, β-glucuronidase, β-glucosidase or ornithine decarboxylase or acid from maltose, d-mannitol, xylitol, melibiose, raffinose, methyl α-d-glucoside, d-ribose, cellobiose, turanose or l-arabinose.
Urea, starch, casein and gelatin are not hydrolysed.

Cultures show negative responses for esterase (C4), lipase (C14), valine arylamidase, cystine arylamidase, trypsin, chymotrypsin, naphthol-AS-BI-phosphohydrolase, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, N-acetyl-β-glucosaminidase, α-mannosidase and α-fucosidase.

Resistant to bacitracin (0.04 U) and lysozyme (400 mg l−1) but susceptible to novobiocin (5 μg), furazolidone (100 μg), amoxicillin/clavulanic acid (20/10 μg), oxacillin (1 μg), tetracycline (30 μg), trimethoprim/sulfamethoxazole (23.75/1.25 μg), erythromycin (15 μg), clindamycin (2 μg), vancomycin (30 μg), ciprophloxacin (5 μg), gentamicin (10 μg), chloramphenicol (30 μg), rifampicin (5 μg), teicoplanin (30 μg) and lysostaphin (50 mg l−1).
Dominant fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C17 : 0, anteiso-C15 : 0, C18 : 2ω6,9c/anteiso-C18 : 0, C18 : 0 and C18 : 1ω9c.
Peptidoglycan type is A3α l-Lys–Gly2–3–l-Ser–Gly and the quinone system includes the major component menaquinone MK-7 and minor quantities of MK-6 and MK-8.
The polar lipid profile consists of the major compounds diphosphatidylglycerol and phosphatidylglycerol.

Additionally, moderate amounts of an unknown glycolipid and an unknown aminophospholipid and minor amounts of another glycolipid, an aminophospholipid, a phospholipid and a polar lipid are detectable.
The type strain is 4005-LJ(m)T (=CCM 4903T =CCUG 55861T =DSM 22147T), isolated from the liver of a free-living common vole in the Czech Republic.
Its characteristics are in full agreement with those given in the species description.
